alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Central Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued February 27 at 2:34AM PST until February 28 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 1 PM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 10 to 11 feet with dangerous rip currents. Surf will be highest on west and northwest facing beaches. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Central Coast and Santa Barbara County Central Coast. * WHEN...From 1 PM this afternoon to 1 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Central Coast
